TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
TA-TA-TAN!

... they will land on the "reverse universe", where bad Kerbals shoot down people orbiting Kerbin without permission...

... a world where Mortimer is "The Supreme Ruler"...

... a world driven by economic rules and profit..... ehm... no... that it's our world... LOL ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)

Well. Interesting.

I liked that.

It gives me an idea. You weave such a fascinating tale, Kuzzter. I keep coming back to the mystery and wondering who you have set in opposition to our familiar kerbonauts.

Thanks, and

Happy landings!
They didn't stumble upon any transdimensional anomaly along the way, didn't they?

> 
> They didn't stumble upon any transdimensional anomaly along the way, didn't they?

SOI change = transdimensional anomaly?

I thought about just posting the first two pages of this update and letting you wonder... but anyway here's five. You're welcome ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![v5AaaUb.png](http://i.imgur.com/v5AaaUb.png)

![tRAujo8.png](http://i.imgur.com/tRAujo8.png)

![9dqrFjy.png](http://i.imgur.com/9dqrFjy.png)

![HorQJrZ.png](http://i.imgur.com/HorQJrZ.png)

![ffFsrkE.png](http://i.imgur.com/ffFsrkE.png)

> 
> TA-TA-TAN!
> ... they will land on the "reverse universe", where bad Kerbals shoot down people orbiting Kerbin without permission...
> 
> ... a world where Mortimer is "The Supreme Ruler"...
> 
> ... a world driven by economic rules and profit..... ehm... no... that it's our world... LOL ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)

Our world indeed, and welcome back to it! Hope that much is clear from this update ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> It gives me an idea. You weave such a fascinating tale, Kuzzter. I keep coming back to the mystery and wondering who you have set in opposition to our familiar kerbonauts.

"Opposition" indeed. Well, you should know by now that I'm not in the habit of wasting panels, or dialogue. (there, *that* should get the tinfoil hats back out...)

> 
> They didn't stumble upon any transdimensional anomaly along the way, didn't they?

> 
> SOI change = transdimensional anomaly?

Well that's been known to happen, but not in a good way... (see: Clauselle and the Space Beet)

Next up, Jeb flies the Fundstar back to KSC1, we'll get everyone else from *Kranefly* down to the surface--and then we'll see if Admiral Shirley can sort it all out. It's trial time!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-02T14:04:36Z" title="11/02/2015 02:04  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 2, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**
Awesome!

Up next: "The 'True'\* Kerbalwood Story" of what those tourists did while they were 'delayed'

\*several liberties with the truth have been taken, and people and events modified to make the story much less boring.
Also, why did Bill EVA? Did he need to stretch or something?

> 
> Also, why did Bill EVA? Did he need to stretch or something?

In-story, he had to release the klaw manually. In-gameplay, I was pretty confident I could land the M7 softly enough for the cockpit to survive, but I wasn't so sure about the crew cabin ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Oh, I see. Also, Kerbfleet better get some extra snacks for those poor tourists.

Wonderful!

I began to suspect that he was going to get the tourists on page two. Beautifully played, sir.

Happy landings!

> 
> Oh, I see. Also, Kerbfleet better get some extra snacks for those poor tourists.

Oh yes. [FDC Regulations clearly state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flight_Delay_Compensation_Regulation#Refreshments.2C_communication_and_accommodation) that they should be offered, without charge, "Meals and refreshments in proportion to the waiting time".
The tourists were in the fund star for 2 years? Didn't they get bored?

> 
> The tourists were in the fund star for 2 years? Didn't they get bored?

They also died probably.

> 
> They also died probably.

They have probably just hybernated as is established Kuzzterverse lore afaik.
Bill and his reality-bending, persistence tweaking wizardry... Because he was the one to cheat-refuel M7 in orbit - amirite?

> 
> The tourists were in the fund star for 2 years? Didn't they get bored?

No more bored than any other Kerbals stuck in a tin can while you forget about them and do other things.

> 
> They have probably just hybernated as is established Kuzzterverse lore afaik.

Yeah, that's it. Or maybe they played Fizzbin to pass the time?

> 
> Bill and his reality-bending, persistence tweaking wizardry... Because he was the one to cheat-refuel M7 in orbit - amirite?

Not a cheat! *Kranefly* had the fuel and oxidant aboard, Bill just hacked a transfer to the M7's tanks. If you didn't see Bill open the persistence file then I didn't 'cheat' ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Also not stated: of course Bill had a back door built into the code in case Val used the prefix code.
Aw, that criminal mastermind Bill...
Well, Jeb always finishes his mission. ALWAYS ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Well, Jeb always finishes his mission. ALWAYS ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

You're not wrong...

![vfo4Epk.png](http://i.imgur.com/vfo4Epk.png)

Good old Runway 09! Yep, I flew it home for real, no refuel. Fundstar could definitely circumnavigate, maybe 2x if I replaced the passenger cabin with fuel. BTW Jerrod's (non-canon) hair comes from me messing up the texture files and letting Admiral Shirley's head get attached to the default tourist body... or did he just go grey waiting?

***HELL YEAH!***

I see serious jailhouse for Jeb. Or a serious lawyer. Or serious treatment for mental ill.

> 
> Well, you should know by now that I'm not in the habit of wasting panels, or dialogue. (there, *that* should get the tinfoil hats back out...)

My tinfoil hat is on and secured by a geek strap. I've been examining some of the panels with a magnifying glass looking for clues.

The magnifying glass doesn't seem to help, but there sure are clues!

Thanks again.

Happy landings!

I love the Un-snik sound effect too.

Take a look at this:

![3GNJ0r2.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/3GNJ0r2.png?1)

![hEtT6eb.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/hEtT6eb.png?1)

That's right, the aerospikes re-attached themselves!

EDIT:

Tinfoil hat on.

> 
> ... EDIT:
> Tinfoil hat on.

... anti-de-in-refurbished never-meant-to-use-again Tinfoil hat on here too. Grabbing the t-shirt which says "9". Calling a not-closer-known guy on his cellphone. Ordering the red capsule.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-02T20:43:12Z" title="11/02/2015 08:43  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 2, 2015</time> by Mikki**
  
speech:)

> 
> That's right, the aerospikes re-attached themselves!

Amazingly, the starboard one never came off at all--that's the one in front, behind Jeb in the lower panel (any landing you can run away from, whistling, is a DAMN good one!) The port engine is definitely off in both images, you can see it offset from the ship a bit. I've since recovered the contiguous parts of the M7, about 1200 science aboard, but then again it's just from one biome. 

Meanwhile, Jeb cools his heels in the brig waiting for a Gliido to come down with the rest of the team. He got 25xp for this trip and is now at \*\*\*\*\*! Definitely the most qualified pilot in the whole cell block!
